website_summaries.verdict: Instead of simply monitoring your sleep, the Withings Aura helps you fall asleep and wake up with ambient noise, a smart alarm clock, and different colored lights. The steep price tag might convince you to wait until Withings perfects it, though. It's not quite there yet.
pros: Bedside device emits light that helps you fall asleep and wake up
Includes white noise and wake-up sounds
Tracks REM, light, and deep sleep
App consolidates all your Withings data
Alarm clock can be set for a window
cons: No options (at this time) for sleep and wakeup music
Sensor might pick up additional motion after you wake up
Need two sensors to track the sleep of two people in one bed

customer_reviews.title: Part of a great makeover for health
customer_reviews.text: I have some middle age related sleep challenges. I love this thing to help me stay focused and understand my patterns relating them to what I do and how I feel. Also using the Withings scale and BPM monitor. All integrated via the Healthmate app, Other activity tracking is via my iPhone and Watch. I am motivated by data analysis and tracking to reach better understanding and transformation, but this is not for everyone. I like not having to wear a bracelet and never have to think about it doing its job. The data is on my phone a little while after I get up. The sleep programs and smart alarm are a bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Harald Striepe

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced alarm clock
customer_reviews.text: It is basically an overpriced alarm clock. But it works well, it tracks your sleep cycles and integrated heart rate monitor seems to be very accurate. iPhone app is well designed and setup is easy. This is an excellent alarm clock, that cost as much as playstation (nearly double the price of Echo).
customer_reviews.author: Martin Ericson

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap stopped working after a month and 2 days right after the return window.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted exactly 2 days past when I can return it. So a month and 2 days. Turned it on tonight and it’s going haywire ! Just blinking on and off and not connecting. Can control it at all can’t turn it off. Turns back on on it’s own blinking on and off. Did a bunch of trouble shooting deleted app, reset while light, nothing worked just went back to blinking.

customer_reviews.title: Very good, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to set up - still not working properly. That being said, it's fabulous ... 1. Falling asleep to the diminishing red light and crashing waves is very relaxing. I definitely fall asleep faster than I did listening to music. 2. Waking up to the intensifying white light and whimsical music is far less abrupt than the radio or buzzer and is quite effective.

customer_reviews.title: The alarm clock pod is great - I find the sounds and light are great ...
customer_reviews.text: Pondered over whether or not to get this because of the price, but it is worth the money. The alarm clock pod is great - I find the sounds and light are great for sending you to sleep or waking you up. The sleep sensor takes some careful positioning, but once you have it right it is pretty accurate, and the data is useful. Needs some work on the app to make the graphs more usable (zoom capabilities, for example) but updates seem to happen fairly regularly so it is clearly developing. All in all a good buy.

customer_reviews.title: A worthwhile purchase for smart alarm alone
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with the Aura. If this was only a stylish bedside lamp, I'd still purchase it. If this was only a smart alarm, I'd still purchase it. The sleep tracking is an added bonus for me. I find the results useful, but if sleep tracking is your primary reason for purchasing this device and you want the highest possible level of accuracy, you might be better served by another device. I can't live without the smart alarm at this point - it provides the most pleasant, reliable wake up experience I've ever had. I tend to sleep through most alarms, but I have never once slept through the aura alarm.

As a result of the poor sleep tracking, it doesn't work as a smart alarm well (the Jawbone UP24 works much better at this sort of thing). Lastly, the Aura doesn't have all of the advertised functions available at launch and the Withings iPhone app is atrocious.
